page.title: 15HOUSING IN THE SOUTH HAMS
page.content: Houses in this area are expensive because it is considered a good place to live.Prices start from about Â£30,000 for quite a small house.There are 5 big houses owned in the past by the gentry:Gnaton Hall and Puslinch (both still private);Alston Hall and The Laurels,now a luxury hotel and a country club and built arond 1900 by the same architect;and Membland,parts of which are very old and is now divided into flats.Some of the farm houses are several hundred years old as are some of the cottages once "tied" to them.But there are more recent developments,too.At Battisborough Cross bulding began in 1961 and continued into the 1970's. Collaton Park near Newton Ferrers was an RAF station and now the houses are being modernised and sold privately. Continued page 16
